data: CARD SURG Post Operative Atrial Fibrillation (Module)

All of the following criteria MUST be met to activate this protocol:
- New onset, post operative atrial fibrillation
- Epicardial pacing wires present
- No underlying 2nd or 3rd degree heart block prior to onset of atrial fibrillation
- Ventricular rate above 100 and below 180
- Patient denies dizziness, no decreased level of conciousness or syncope
- SBP 90 mmHg or above
- O2 saturation 92% or above and pO2 90 or above (if available)
- Patient denies new shortness of breath
- Patient denies new chest pain/pressure
Level of Monitoring: Class I Monitor At All Times, D/C Monitoring: 48 Hrs Arrhythmia Free, Indication: Arrythmia Atrial
Level of Monitoring: Class II RN May Suspend, D/C Monitoring: 48 Hrs Arrhythmia Free, Indication: Arrythmia Atrial
If patient becomes unstable with any of the following (see order comments)
5 g, IV, as directed, PRN hypomagnesemia, order duration: 2 doses or times, administer over: 4 hour
5 g, IV, as directed, PRN hypomagnesemia, administer over: 4 hour
Select either the beta blocker or the digoxin protocol
Beta Blocker protocol to be used only in the absence of reversible airways disease
25 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
2.5 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
digoxin protocol to be used only if no digoxin has been administered within the past 7 days, or if not already on amiodarone
0.5 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
0.25 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
0.25 mg, IV, q2h interval, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when magnesium sulfate infusion(s) are complete, then order Basic Metabolic Panel, Magnesium Level and Phospate Level, once, 4 hours after final dose
If Electrocardiogram 12 Lead or XR Chest is indicated
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
